value.title: Architect compute infrastructure in Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure compute services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different services that are available in Azure Compute.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cross-platform Azure CLI to create, start, stop, and perform other management tasks related to virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application
topItems.excerpt: Discover the services and tools available to automate the deployment and configuration of your Azure infrastructure.

topItems.title: Deploy consistent infrastructure in Azure by using Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates
topItems.excerpt: Write Azure Resource Manager templates by using Visual Studio Code to deploy your infrastructure to Azure consistently and reliably.

value.title: Architect infrastructure operations in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor, analyze, and manage the ongoing operation of your infrastructure in Azure.

topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Discover ways to use an Azure Storage account to manage your data for billing, access, and storage location of your blobs, files, queues, and tables.

topItems.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

topItems.title: Provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports cloud adoption as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: The cloud fundamentally changes everything. Traditionally, ownership and responsibility for all aspects of the technology you use, from infrastructure to software, has fallen to enterprises. When you move to the cloud, you can instead provision and consume just the resources you need, when you need them. Although the cloud offers tremendous flexibility, to get the most benefit out of your move to the cloud, you need a proven and consistent methodology for adopting cloud technologies. The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure meets that need, helping guide decisions throughout cloud adoption. This learning path provides an overview of the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure and how to use it as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to update plans for federal network infrastructure, including adoption of cloud technology, and report those plans to OMB/NSC, per Section 3 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **July 11, 2021**.

value.title: Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Join Scott Hanselman, Donovan Brown, and Lara Rubbelke as they host the engineers who build & use Azure, demo it, answer questions, and share insights.

topItems.title: Accelerate time to insights with Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Josh Caplan, Sabin Nair, and Priyanka Langade join Scott Hanselman to show how you can use native Azure Synapse Analytical runtimes to analyze Dataverse data and get actionable insights.  Dataverse structures a variety of data and business logic to support interconnected applications and processes in

topItems.excerpt: Learn about the virtual private network (VPN) gateway options in Azure and typical scenarios for using a VPN. Create and test VPNs to securely connect sites to Azure.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports secure software development as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: Secure software development means integrating security into each phase of your development lifecycle, from requirements analysis to maintenance. Microsoft provides many services that can help you develop more secure code and deploy a more secure application in the cloud. This learning path provides an overview of the services and offerings available to help you build secure software as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to comply with NIST/CISA/OMB guidance on security measures for critical software (including applying practices of least privilege, network segmentation, and proper configuration), per section 4 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **August 10, 2021**. The deadline for agencies to comply with the guidance identifying practices that enhance the security of the software supply chain with respect to software procurement, also per section 4, is **March 8, 2022**.

topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How-to” series, learn the benefits of organizing your subscriptions into a hierarchal structure of management groups. topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

value.title: Understand data science for machine learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning is enables data scientists make predictions about objects, people, and the future. This learning path is a high-level introduction to machine learning for people with little or no knowledge of computer science or statistics.

topItems.title: Introduction to machine learning
topItems.excerpt: A high-level overview of machine learning for people with little or no knowledge of computer science and statistics. You’ll be introduced to some essential concepts, explore data, and interactively go through the machine learning life-cycle - using Python to train, save, and use a machine learning model like we would in the real world.

topItems.title: Build classical machine learning models with supervised learning
topItems.excerpt: Supervised learning is a form of machine learning where an algorithm learns from examples of data. We progressively paint a picture of how supervised learning automatically generates a model that can make predictions about the real world. We also touch on how these models are tested, and difficulties that can arise when training them.

topItems.title: Introduction to data for machine learning
topItems.excerpt: The power of machine learning models comes from the data that is used to train them. Through content and exercises, we explore how to understand your data, how to encode it so that the computer can interpret it properly, how to clean it of errors, and tips that will help you create models that perform well.

topItems.title: Train and understand regression models in machine learning
topItems.excerpt: Regression is arguably the most widely used machine learning technique, commonly underlying scientific discoveries, business planning, and stock market analytics. This learning material takes a dive into some common regression analyses, both simple and more complex, and provides some insight on how to assess model performance.

value.title: Deliver remote desktops and apps from Azure with Windows Virtual Desktop
value.excerpt: Windows Virtual Desktop on Microsoft Azure is a desktop and app virtualization service that runs on the cloud. Windows Virtual Desktop works across devices – including Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android – with full-featured apps that you can use to access remote desktops and apps.

topItems.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Windows Virtual Desktop to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop - a cloud-based virtualization solution running on Microsoft Azure. Windows Virtual Desktop is an elastically scalable service to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences - without having to manage the underlying server infrastructure. Review the prerequisites and tools provided by Microsoft get ready to provision your first Windows Virtual Desktop host pool.

topItems.title: Deploy Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Windows Virtual Desktop and customize the workspace for your users.

topItems.title: Optimize Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn the steps to optimize Windows Virtual Desktop, including how to take advantage of new storage, file management, and automated scaling options.
